isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - Driver Controlled Main Differential Lock - Remove Differential Carrier from Axle Housing

svcproc.title: Remove Differential Carrier from Axle Housing

svcprocinfo.para: Before the differential carrier can be removed or installed, the differential lock MUST be shifted into and held in the locked (engaged) position. The locked position gives enough clearance between the shift collar and the axle housing to permit the removal or installation of the carrier.

note.para: If the axle shafts were removed for towing with the differential in the unlocked (disengaged) position, install the left-hand axle shaft into the housing before continuing. Follow steps 1 and 2 of BEFORE OPERATING THE VEHICLE.

svcprocinfo.para: To shift into the locked position, use either of the following "Air Pressure" or "Manual Engaging" methods.

step1.para: Remove the drain plug from the bottom of the housing and drain the lubricant.
Raise the left-hand wheel of the drive axle off the floor with a hoist or jack.

warning.para: Do not start the vehicle engine and engage the transmission with one wheel raised from the floor. When the differential is in locked (engaged) position, power will go to the wheel on the floor and cause the vehicle to move and may cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Put a jack stand under the left-hand spring seat to hold the vehicle in the raised position.

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or tip over and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Disconnect the driveline from the input yoke.
Disconnect the vehicle air line from the inter-axle differential and main differential lock actuator assemblies.
Connect an auxiliary air supply to the differential lock actuator assembly.

note.para: If an auxiliary air supply is not available, continue to Manual Engaging Method of locking the differential.

step1.para: Apply and hold air pressure to the actuator assembly. The air pressure will move the shift collar to engage with the splines on the differential case half and lock the assembly.

Make sure that the shift collar has moved the full distance on the splines of the differential case half. Rotate the left-hand wheel until the left-hand wheel makes one complete rotation (forward or backward). The differential is fully engaged at this time and will not be able to rotate the wheel.
Continue to hold the main differential in the locked position with air pressure until the carrier assembly is completely removed from the axle housing.
Remove the axle shafts from the housing. Follow steps 1 and 2 of " Before Towing."
Remove the carrier from the housing as described in Steps 8 through 23 under DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER FROM THE AXLE HOUSING.
After the carrier is removed from the axle housing, release the air pressure from the actuator assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Manual Engaging Method
svcsubproc.para: If an auxiliary air supply is not available or if the differential carrier is to be stored for later use, use this manual engaging method ( Figure 166 and Figure 167).

8. BOTTOM SIDE STORAGE HOLE FOR PLUG AND GASKET
3. STORAGE OF MANUAL ENGAGING BOLT IN SHIFT TOWER LOCATION
4. INSERT MANUAL ENGAGING BOLT TO ENGAGE DIFF. LOCK

step1.para: Follow steps 1 through 5 of the " Air Pressure Method."
Remove the plug and gasket from the hole in the center of the cylinder cover or cylinder.
Remove the manual engaging bolt from the top storage hole in the cylinder cover or shift tower of carriers with the threaded type shift assembly ( Figure 166 and Figure 167).
Install the plug and gasket into the bottom storage hole in the cylinder cover, or in the shift tower.

note.para: Bolt On Shift Assembly - The storage hole for the plug and gasket is the opposite end of the storage hole for the manual engaging bolt ( Figure 166).

step1.para: Install the manual engaging bolt into the threaded hole in the center of the cylinder cover or cylinder.

Turn the manual adjusting bolt to the right until the head is approximately 1/4 inch from the cylinder cover. DO NOT turn the bolt beyond its normal stop. The bolt is now in the service position and the main differential lock is completely engaged.

caution.para: There will be a small amount of spring resistance felt when you turn in the manual engaging bolt. If a high resistance is felt before reaching the locked (engaged) position, STOP TURNING THE BOLT or the cover, the fork and bolt threads will be damaged.

note.para: A high resistance on the bolt indicates that the splines of the shift collar and the differential case half are not aligned or engaged. To align the splines, use the following procedure:

step2.para: Rotate the left-hand wheel to align the splines of the shift collar and case half while you turn in the manual engaging bolt.

When the normal amount of spring resistance is again felt on the bolt, the splines are engaged. Continue to turn in the manual engaging bolt until the head is approximately 1/4 inch from the cylinder cover.

step1.para: Remove the carrier from the axle housing as described in steps 8-23 under DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER FROM THE AXLE HOUSING.
Release the differential lock by removing the manual engaging bolt and seal from the cylinder cover or cylinder.
